Class Plurality

  • java.lang.Object
    • Plurality
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VotingAlgorithm

    public class Plurality
extends java.lang.Object
implements VotingAlgorithm

    Plurality Class

    This file does the bulk of tabulating votes from the election class when the plurality vote type is selected and produces a winners queue and losers stack, which is updated for the election class
    Author:
    Sami Frank

    • Constructor Detail

      • Plurality

        public Plurality(Election e)
        Plurality constructor. It takes in a new election (type plurality), and retrieves the election's ballots, and number of seats to fill.
        Parameters:
        e - - the election object which provides information on the election needed by the Plurality instance to compute the election.

    • Method Detail

      • distributeVotes

        public void distributeVotes()
        This method will take a the list of ballots that was set in the constructor. The method will then assign ballots to their respective candidate objects. This method also will create a HashMap called finalVoteCounts that will store a Candidate object as the key and their total vote count as the value. finalVoteCounts will be used in Pluralities evaluate() method.
        Specified by:
        distributeVotes in interface VotingAlgorithm

      • breakTie

        protected void breakTie(java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> tie)
        breakTie will take in a list of Candidate objects who have been determined to have a tie in their total vote counts. This method will evaluate how many available seats there currently are and if there are enough seats left, all candidates in the list would be added to the winners list, if there aren't enough seats available for all candidates in the list, the list will shuffle and candidates will get randomly selected for the seat until the list is empty or there are no more seats to fill, whichever comes first.

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate()
        evaluate() will sort the finalVoteCounts HashMap in descending order into an ArrayList sortedCandidates. The method then iterates over the sortedCandidates list. It will check two candidates vote count. If the first candidate to be looked at has a higher vote count than the second candidate to be looked at, the first candidate would win, if there are seats available. If both candidates have the same vote count, they're both added to a tie list. breakTie will be called once it has been determined that there isn't another candidate tied with candidates currently in the tie list. After the candidates have been fully evaluated, the winners and losers are set in the election class.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface VotingAlgorithm
